metadata.title: Caching of logon credentials
metadata.description: Caching of logon credentials is not limited.

metadata.title: UR: Act as part of the operating system
metadata.description: UR: Act as part of the operating system - (None)

metadata.title: Minimum Password Age
metadata.description: Minimum password age does not meet minimum requirements.

metadata.title: Rename Built-in Guest Account
metadata.description: The built-in guest account has not been renamed.

metadata.title: Rename Built-in Administrator Account
metadata.description: The built-in administrator account has not been renamed.

metadata.title: System File ACLs
metadata.description: ACLs for system files and directories do not conform to minimum requirements.

metadata.title: Forcibly Disconnect when Logon Hours Expire
metadata.description: Users are not forcibly disconnected when logon hours expire.

metadata.title: Unencrypted Password is Sent to SMB Server.
metadata.description: Unencrypted password is sent to 3rd party SMB Server.

metadata.title: Secure Print Driver Installation
metadata.description: Print driver installation privilege is not restricted to administrators.

metadata.title: LanMan Authentication Level
metadata.description: The Send download LanMan compatible password option is not set to Send NTLMv2 response only\refuse LM.

metadata.title: Ctrl+Alt+Del Security Attention Sequence
metadata.description: Ctrl+Alt+Del security attention sequence is Disabled.

metadata.title: V0014229 - Audit Backup and Restore Privileges
metadata.description: V0014229 - Audit Backup and Restore Privileges

metadata.title: Recovery Console - SET Command
metadata.description: The Recovery Console SET command is enabled.

metadata.title: Recovery Console - Automatic Logon
metadata.description: The Recovery Console option is set to permit automatic logon to the system.

metadata.title: SMB Server Packet Signing (if client agrees)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB server is not enabled to perform SMB packet signing when possible.

metadata.title: Encryption of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic is not encrypted when possible.

metadata.title: Signing of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic is not signed when possible.

metadata.title: Computer Account Password Reset
metadata.description: The computer account password is prevented from being reset.

metadata.title: SMB Client Packet Signing (if server agrees)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB client is not enabled to perform SMB packet signing when possible.

metadata.title: Format and Eject Removable Media
metadata.description: Ejection of removable NTFS media is not restricted to Administrators.

metadata.title: Password Expiration Warning
metadata.description: Users are not warned in advance that their passwords will expire.

metadata.title: Global System Objects Permission Strength
metadata.description: The default permissions of Global system objects are not increased.

metadata.title: Idle Time Before Suspending a Session.
metadata.description: Amount of idle time required before suspending a session is improperly set.

metadata.title: Display of Last User Name
metadata.description: The system is configured to allow the display of the last user name on the logon screen.

metadata.title: Audit Access to Global System Objects
metadata.description: Audit Access to Global System Objects is not turned off.

metadata.title: Audit Backup and Restore Privileges
metadata.description: Audit of Backup and Restore Privileges is not turned off.

metadata.title: Audit Policy Subcategory Setting
metadata.description: Audit policy using subcategories is enabled.

metadata.description: User Account Control - Built In Admin Approval Mode

metadata.title: UAC - Application Installations
metadata.description: User Account Control - Detect Application Installations

metadata.title: UAC - UIAccess Application Elevation
metadata.description: User Account Control - Elevate UIAccess applications that are in secure locations

metadata.description: User Account Control - Run all admins in Admin Approval Mode

metadata.title: UAC - Secure Desktop Mode

metadata.title: UAC - Non UAC Compliant Application Virtualization
metadata.description: User Account Control - Non UAC Compliant Application Virtualization

metadata.title: Enumerate Administrator Accounts on Elevation
metadata.description: Require username and password to elevate a running application.

metadata.title: RS/RDS - Prevent Password Saving
metadata.description: Terminal Services / Remote Desktop Service - Prevent password saving in the Remote Desktop Client

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Drive Redirection
metadata.description: Terminal Services / Remote Desktop Services - Local drives prevented from sharing with Terminal Servers.

metadata.title: RPC - Endpoint Mapper Authentication
metadata.description: Client computers required to authenticate for RPC communication.

metadata.title: Publish to Web
metadata.description: File and Folder Publish to Web option unavailable.

metadata.title: Internet Download / Online Ordering
metadata.description: Web Publishing and online ordering wizards prevented from downloading list of providers.

metadata.title: Windows Messenger Experience Improvement
metadata.description: Windows Messenger prevented from collecting anonymous information.

metadata.title: Search Companion Content File Updates
metadata.description: Search Companion prevented from automatically downloading content updates.

metadata.title: HTTP Printer Drivers
metadata.description: Computer prevented from downloading print driver packages over HTTP.

metadata.title: Windows Update Device Drive Searching
metadata.description: Windows is prevented from using Windows Update to search for drivers.

metadata.title: Limit Blank Passwords
metadata.description: The use of local accounts with blank passwords is not restricted to console logons only.

metadata.title: Windows Messenger - Do Not Allow To Run
metadata.description: The user is allowed to launch Windows Messenger (MSN Messenger, .NET Messenger).

metadata.title: Windows Messenger - Do Not Start Automatically
metadata.description: Windows Messenger (MSN Messenger, .NET messenger) is run at system startup.

metadata.title: Undock Without Logging On
metadata.description: The system can be removed from the docking station without logging on first.

metadata.title: Maximum Machine Account Password Age
metadata.description: The maximum age for machine account passwords is not set to requirements.

metadata.title: Strong Session Key
metadata.description: The system is not configured to require a strong session key.

metadata.title: Storage of Passwords and Credentials
metadata.description: The system is configured to permit storage of credentials or .NET Passports.

metadata.title: Sharing and Security Model for Local Accounts
metadata.description: The system is not configured to use the Classic security model.

metadata.title: LAN Manager Hash Value Stored
metadata.description: The system is configured to store the LAN Manager hash of the password in the SAM.

metadata.title: LDAP Client Signing
metadata.description: The system is not configured to recommended LDAP client signing requirements.

metadata.title: Session Security for NTLM SSP Based Clients
metadata.description: The system is not configured to meet the minimum requirement for session security for NTLM SSP based Clients.

metadata.title: FIPS Compliant Algorithms
metadata.description: The system is not configured to use FIPS compliant Algorithms for Encryption, Hashing, and Signing.

metadata.title: Case Insensitivity for Non-Windows
metadata.description: The system is configured to allow case insensitivity.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Set Encryption Level
metadata.description: Terminal Services is not configured with the client connection encryption set to the required level.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Do Not Use Temp Folders
metadata.description: Terminal Services is configured to use a common temporary folder for all sessions.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Delete Temp Folders
metadata.description: Terminal Services is not configured to delete temporary folders.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Time Limit for Disc. Session
metadata.description: Terminal Services is not configured to set a time limit for disconnected sessions.

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Time Limit for Idle Session
metadata.description: Terminal Services is configured to allow an Idle session limit does not meet the requirement.

metadata.title: Group Policy - Do Not Turn off Background Refresh
metadata.description: The system is configured to prevent background refresh of Group Policy.

metadata.title: Remote Assistance - Offer Remote Assistance
metadata.description: The system is configured to allow unsolicited remote assistance offers.

metadata.title: Error Reporting - Report Errors
metadata.description: The system is configured to automatically forward error information.

metadata.title: Windows Time Service - Configure NTP Client
metadata.description: The system is configured to use an unauthorized time server.

metadata.title: Media Player - Disable Automatic Updates
metadata.description: Media Player is configured to allow automatic checking for updates.

metadata.title: Session Security for NTLM SSP based Servers
metadata.description: The system is not configured to meet the minimum requirement for session security for NTLM SSP based Servers.

metadata.title: Strong Key Protection
metadata.description: Users are not required to enter a password to access private keys.

metadata.title: Software Restriction Policies
metadata.description: Software certificate restriction policies are not enforced.

metadata.title: Group Policy - Registry Policy Processing
metadata.description: Group Policy objects are not reprocessed if they have not changed.

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to Named Pipes and Shares
metadata.description: Named Pipes and Shares can be accessed anonymously.

metadata.title: Minimum Password Length
metadata.description: For systems utilizing a logon ID as the individual identifier, passwords are not at a minimum of 14-characters.

metadata.title: Display Shutdown Button
metadata.description: Displaying the shutdown button may allow individuals to shut down a system anonymously. Only authenticated users should be allowed to shut down the system. Preventing display of this button in the logon dialog box, ensures that individuals who shut down the system are authorized and tracked in the systems Security event log.

criterion.comment: Default comment, please change

metadata.title: File Auditing Configuration
metadata.description: Improper modification of the core system files can render a system inoperable. Further, modifications to these system files can have a significant impact on the security configuration of the system. Auditing of significant modifications made to the system files provides a method of determining the responsible party.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives>Automated checking sometimes reports this as a false finding. If a manual review of a questionable finding shows auditing to be set correctly, then this would not be a finding.

criterion.comment: Volumes use NTFS
Audit Object Access Failure
Audit Object Access Failure and Success

criteria.comment: Local volumes audit permissions are set correctly.

metadata.title: Bad Logon Attempts
metadata.description: Number of allowed bad-logon attempts does not meet minimum requirements

metadata.title: Bad Logon Counter Reset
metadata.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time that must pass between two successive login attempts to ensure that a lockout will occur. The smaller this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system.

criteria.comment: Ensure lockout counter is greater than or equal to 60 minutes

criterion.comment: Ensure lockout counter is greater than or equal to 60 minutes

metadata.title: Lockout Duration
metadata.description: Lockout duration does not meet minimum requirements

criterion.comment: Tests if account lockout duration is properly set

Automatic logon password is not saved

metadata.title: Deny Access from the Network
metadata.description: User Right to Deny Access to this computer from the network is not configured to include Guests.

metadata.title: Smart Card Removal Option
metadata.description:
Determines what should happen when the smart card for a logged-on user is removed from the smart card reader.
The options are: - No Action - Lock Workstation - Force Logoff

Configure Smart Card Removal Option - force logoff

metadata.description: This setting helps define the permissions that anonymous users have. If this setting is enabled then anonymous users have the same rights and permissions as the built-in Everyone group. Anonymous users should not have these permissions or rights.

criterion.comment: Default comment, please change

ICMP Redirect is disabled
Router Discovery is disabled

metadata.title: Name-Release Attacks
metadata.description: Verifies Allow computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers is enabled

criterion.comment: Allow computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers is enabled

metadata.title: TCP Data Retransmissions
metadata.description: In a SYN flood attack, the attacker sends a continuous stream of SYN packets to a server, and the server leaves the half-open connections open until it is overwhelmed and no longer is able to respond to legitimate requests.

criteria.comment: Configure the system to control the maximum number of times that TCP retransmits unacknowledged data segments before aborting the attempt.

criterion.comment: Configure the system to control the maximum number of times that TCP retransmits unacknowledged data segments before aborting the attempt.

metadata.title: Screen Saver Grace Period
metadata.description: Verifies Screen Saver Grace Period is set to 5 seconds or less

criterion.comment: Screen Saver Grace Period is set to 5 seconds or less

metadata.title: Remotely Accessible Registry Paths and Sub-Paths
metadata.description: Determines if unauthorized registry paths and sub-paths are remotely accessible

criterion.comment: Registry key AllowedPaths has specific values
Registry key AllowedPaths does not exist
Registry key AllowedPaths is blank

metadata.title: Optional Subsystems
metadata.description: The POSIX subsystem is an Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers (IEEE) standard that defines a set of operating system services. The POSIX Subsystem is required if the server supports applications that use that subsystem. The subsystem introduces a security risk relating to processes that can potentially persist across logins. That is, if a user starts a process and then logs out, there is a potential that the next user who logs in to the system could access the previous users process. This is dangerous because the process started by the first user may retain that users system privileges; anything the second user does with that process will be performed with the privileges of the first user.

criteria.comment: Configure the system to prevent optional subsystems such as Posix to operate on the system.

criterion.comment: Configure the system to prevent optional subsystems such as Posix to operate on the system.

metadata.title: Terminal Services - Secure RPC Connection
metadata.description: Allowing unsecure RPC communication exposes the server to man in the middle attacks and data disclosure attacks. A man in the middle attack occurs when an intruder captures packets between a client and server and modifies them before allowing the packets to be exchanged. Usually the attacker will modify the information in the packets in an attempt to cause either the client or server to reveal sensitive information.

criteria.comment: Configure the Terminal Server to require secure RPC communication

criterion.comment: Configure the Terminal Server to require secure RPC communication

metadata.title: Encrypting and Signing of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic is not encrypted or signed

criterion.comment: Policy is configured properly

metadata.title: Password Requirement
metadata.description: Determines compliance with per-user password expiration requirement

criterion.comment: Tests if all user accounts require passwords (PA)
Tests if all user accounts require passwords (Other)

metadata.title: Auditing Configuration
metadata.description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, analyze compromises that have occurred as well as detect an attack that has begun or is about to begin. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Without an audit trail that provides information as to event that occurred and if it was successful or unsuccessful, it is difficult to analyze a series of events to determine the steps used by an attacker to compromise a system or network, or what exactly happened that led to a denial of service. Collecting data such as the successful and unsuccessful events is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

registry_object.comment: Defines the registry key for disabling automatic logons
registry_object.name: AutoAdminLogon

registry_object.comment: Defines the registry key where a password is saved for automatic logon
registry_object.name: defaultpassword

accesstoken_object.comment: Deny Guest Access from the Network

registry_object.comment: Configure the system to restrict anonymous users from the Everyone group
registry_object.name: everyoneincludesanonymous

registry_object.comment: Defines the registry key for enabling Safe DLL Search Mode
registry_object.name: SafeDllSearchMode

registry_object.comment: Defines the registry key for the Audit Log Warning Level
registry_object.name: WarningLevel

registry_object.comment: Configure the system to disable IP source routing.
registry_object.name: DisableIPSourceRouting

registry_object.comment: Defines the registry key for disabling ICMP Redirect
registry_object.name: EnableICMPRedirect

registry_object.comment: Defines the registry key for disabling Router Discovery
registry_object.name: PerformRouterDiscovery

registry_object.comment: Defines the registry key for No Name Release on Demand
registry_object.name: NoNameReleaseOnDemand

registry_object.comment: Configure the system to control the maximum number of times that TCP retransmits unacknowledged data segments before aborting the attempt.
registry_object.name: TcpMaxDataRetransmissions

registry_object.comment: Defines the registry key for the Screen Saver Grace Period
registry_object.name: ScreenSaverGracePeriod

registry_object.comment: Configure the system to prevent optional subsystems such as Posix to operate on the system.
registry_object.name: Optional

registry_object.comment: Configure the Terminal Server to require secure RPC communication
registry_object.name: fEncryptRPCTraffic

wmi_object.wql: SELECT PasswordExpires FROM Win32_UserAccount WHERE NOT sid LIKE "S-1-5-21%-500"

registry_object.comment: Ensure registry key is configured correctly
registry_object.name: nodefaultexempt

registry_object.comment: Ensure registry key is configured correctly
registry_object.name: ConsentPromptBehaviorAdmin

registry_object.comment: Ensure registry key is configured correctly
registry_object.name: ConsentPromptBehaviorUser

registry_object.comment: Ensure registry key is configured correctly
registry_object.name: DisabledComponents

registry_object.comment: Defines the registry key for disabling Windows Error Reporting
registry_object.name: Disabled

registry_object.comment: Defines the registry key for Allow UIAccess applications to prompt for elevation without using the secure desktop
registry_object.name: EnableUIADesktopToggle

registry_object.comment: Defines the registry key for Remove ‘Disconnect’ option from the Shut Down dialog
registry_object.name: NoDisconnect

registry_object.comment: Defines the registry key for MSS: (NtfsDisable8dot3NameCreation) Enable the computer to stop generating 8.3 style filenames (recommended)
registry_object.name: NtfsDisable8dot3NameCreation

registry_object.comment: Ensure registry key autorun.inf is configured correctly
Registry value for task scheduling - server operators
registry_object.name: SubmitControl

wmi_object.comment: Kerberos Policy - Enforce user logon restrictions
wmi_object.wql: SELECT setting FROM RSOP_SecuritySettingBoolean WHERE KeyName='TicketValidateClient'

wmi_object.comment: Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for service ticket must be 600 or less
wmi_object.wql: SELECT setting FROM RSOP_SecuritySettingNumeric WHERE KeyName='MaxServiceAge'

wmi_object.comment: Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for user ticket must be 10 days or less
wmi_object.wql: SELECT setting FROM RSOP_SecuritySettingNumeric WHERE KeyName='MaxTicketAge'

wmi_object.comment: Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for user ticket renewal must be 7 days or less
wmi_object.wql: SELECT setting FROM RSOP_SecuritySettingNumeric WHERE KeyName='MaxRenewAge'

wmi_object.comment: Kerberos Policy - Maximum tolerance for computer clock synchronization must be 5 minutes or less
wmi_object.wql: SELECT setting FROM RSOP_SecuritySettingNumeric WHERE KeyName='MaxClockSkew'

registry_object.comment: Registry value for LDAP Server signing requirements
registry_object.name: LDAPServerIntegrity

registry_object.comment: Registry value for Domain Controller: Refuse machine account password changes
registry_object.name: RefusePasswordChange

wmi_object.wql: SELECT name FROM win32_logicaldisk WHERE drivetype=3
